PriceRevisionPolicy.name: PriceRevisionPolicy
PriceRevisionPolicy.description: Represents the guidelines and methods used to modify product or service prices, often incorporating formulas based on price revision entries and various adjustments. For example, a policy might dictate that prices are revised based on a formula that considers the regional Consumer Price Index (CPI) with a specific adjustment percentage, effective from a defined date, and categorized as either a flat adjustment or one directly based on the price revision entry data.

EffectiveFrom.description: The date and time when the price revision policy comes into effect.

EffectiveTo.description: The date and time when the price revision policy is no longer in effect.

Formula.description: The coded format of the formula used to calculate the revised price of a product from a quote and order, or contract.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

Name.description: The name of the price revision policy.

OwnerId.description: ID of the user who created the record.

PolicyType.description: The type of price revision policy.

Region.description: The region where the price revision policy is valid.
